page.title: 01Summary
page.content: The area between the village of Gelston and Screel Hill is intensively farmed, and includes areas of forestry cultivated by the Forestry Commission. The small population in the area is by and large connected with farming. The region of Gelston Estate which falls within our boundary is also used as grazing or for private cultivation of forestry. Screel Hill is a popular walk, with trails created by the Forestry Commission marked out for the public. Conifers grown by the Forestry cover two-thirds of the hill, the rest being sheer granite.
